question: 41. Which of the following need to be considered across all regions in your account? (Choose two.)
42. What HTTP code would you expect after a successful upload of an object to an S3 bucket?
43. What is the durability of S3 One Zone-IA?
44. What is the durability of S3-IA?
45. What is the durability of S3?
46. What is the availability of S3 One Zone-IA?
47. What is the availability of S3-IA?
48. What is the availability of S3?
49. Which S3 storage class supports SSL for data in transit?
50. Which S3 storage class supports encryption for data at rest?
51. For which of the following storage classes do you need to specify a region?
52. For which of the following storage classes do you need to specify an availability zone?
53. How does S3 store your objects?
options: D. As blocks in a block storage

question: 54. In what ways can you access your data stored in S3 buckets? (Choose two.)
options: C. Through a REST-based web service interface
A. Through FTP access to the bucket
B. Through SFTP access to the bucket
answers: C. Through a REST-based web service interface

question: 55. Which of the following are true about S3 data access when traffic spikes (increases)? (Choose two.)
options: A. S3 will scale to handle the load if you have Auto Scaling set up.
B. S3 will scale automatically to ensure your service is not interrupted.
D. A few instances are scaled up dramatically to minimize the effect of the spike.
C. Scale spreads evenly across AWS network to minimize the effect of a spike.
answers: B. S3 will scale automatically to ensure your service is not interrupted.
C. Scale spreads evenly across AWS network to minimize the effect of a spike.

question: 56. You have been tasked with helping a company migrate its expensive off-premises storage to AWS. It will still primarily back up files from its on-premises location to a local NAS. These files then need to be stored off-site (in AWS rather than the original off-site location). The company is concerned with durability and cost and wants to retain quick access to its files. What should you recommend?
options: C. Copying the files from the NAS to EBS volumes with provisioned IOPS
A. Copying files from the NAS to an S3 standard class bucket
B. Copying files from the NAS to an S3 One Zone-IA class bucket
D. Copying the files from the NAS to Amazon Glacier
answers: B. Copying files from the NAS to an S3 One Zone-IA class bucket

question: 57. Which S3 storage class would you recommend if you were building out storage for an application that you anticipated growing in size exponentially over the next 12 months?
options: D. There is not enough information to make a good decision.
answers: D. There is not enough information to make a good decision.

question: 58. How many S3 buckets can you create per AWS account, by default?
options: D. There is not a default limit.

question: 59. How are objects uploaded to S3 by default?
options: C. You must configure this option for each S3 bucket explicitly.

question: 60. When does AWS suggest you start uploading objects via the Multipart Upload API?
options: A. When you’re uploading a lot of files at once
B. When you’re uploading files of 10 GB or more
D. When you need the greatest network throughput for uploads
C. When you have multiple applications uploading files to the same S3 bucket
answers: B. When you’re uploading files of 10 GB or more
